item.title: Notes for Control System
item.author: cmpute@foxmail.com (Jacob Zhong)
item.description:
In this note, $f\in\mathbb{F}^\mathbb{G}$ stands for a function with domain in $\mathbb{G}$ and co-domain in $\mathbb{F}$, i.e. $f:\mathbb{F}\to\mathbb{G}$, $H(x)$ generally stands for Heaviside function (step function) Please read the Algebra Basics notes first if you are not familiar with related concepts. Transforms Laplace Transform Definition: $F(s)=\mathcal{L}\{f(t)\}(s)=\int^\infty_0 f(t)e^{-st}\mathrm{d}t$ Note that the transform is not well defined for all functions in $\mathbb{C}^\mathbb{R}$. And the transform is only valid for $s$ in a region of convergence, which is usually separated by 0.
Go to webpage to read full text.
